succumb.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to stop opposing someone or something that is stronger than you, and allow them to take control
succumb.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Succumbing to pressure from the chemical industry, Governor Blakely amended the regulations.
Gina succumbed to temptation and had a second serving of cake.
succumb.translation[0].definitions[1].de: if you succumb to an illness, you become very ill or die of it
succumb.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: About 400,000 Americans succumb each year to smoking-related illnesses.
